title: PBL and Peer Assessment Workshop for Imagination-Driven Mathematics Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course where pre-service teachers design imagination-based learning activities and exchange feedback through peer assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can demonstrate creativity by designing three types of PBL-based mathematical problem-solving scenarios (poetry, songs, role-play)
Evaluate peers' instructional innovation cases using a peer assessment rubric based on five criteria: motivation, empathy, knowledge retention, critical thinking, and feasibility.
Create and share one math concept visualization content using smartphone-based tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
